question: Who is the first cricketer to play 100 matches in all three formats of the game?
explanation:
Veteran Cricketer of the New Zealand Team, Ross Taylor recently created history by becoming the first cricketer to play 100 matches in all three formats of the game- Test, ODI, T20 I.
He achieved this feat during the first test match against India in Wellington. The 35-year-old batsman played his 100th T20 International against India last month. Taylor is also the leading run-scorer of New Zealand, in Test and ODI formats.
